data.name: XMultiPropertyStates
desc: makes it possible to query information about the state of one or more properties.
The state of a property contains information about the source of the value, e.g. the object itself, a default or a stylesheet. For more information see PropertyState.

methods.name: getPropertyDefaults
desc: If no default exists, is not known, or is void, then the return type at the corresponding position in the sequence returned is void.

methods.name: getPropertyStates
desc: The order of the states is correlating to the order of the given property names.

methods.name: setAllPropertiesToDefault
desc: sets all properties to their default values.

Each value depends on the implementation of this interface. If it is a bound property, you must change the value before the change events are fired. If it is a constrained property, you must fire the vetoable event before you change the property value.

methods.name: setPropertiesToDefault
desc: sets the specified properties to their default values.

Each value depends on the implementation of this interface. If it is a bound property, you must change the value before the change events are fired. If it is a constrained property, you must fire the vetoable event before you change the property value.
